daily_schedule.description: The awakening ceremony with Vedic chants and nadaswaram music
The first grand waving of lamps to the deities
Open for pilgrim darshan. Special Sparsha Darshan available during this time (ticketed).
Sanctum closed for cleaning and decoration of the deities
The main evening service with elaborate offerings
The final ritual where the deities are ceremonially 'put to sleep'

abhishekam.name: Rudrabhishekam
abhishekam.description: The most important ritual—bathing the Linga with Panchamrita (milk, curd, honey, ghee, sugar) and sacred water from Pathalaganga

for_bhramaramba.description: Worship with vermilion, symbolizing fertility and shakti power

sparsha_darshan.name: Sparsha Darshan
sparsha_darshan.uniqueness: One of the few major temples allowing this
sparsha_darshan.description: Devotees enter the Garbhagriha and physically touch the Shiva Linga with their own hands to perform Abhishekam
sparsha_darshan.significance: This tactile connection is considered highly merit-giving—a rare privilege in temple worship
sparsha_darshan.who_can_access: All devotees with ticket; Chenchu tribe has traditional rights

shikhara_darshan.name: Shikhara Darshan
shikhara_darshan.location: Shikhareswara Swamy Temple, 8 km from main temple
shikhara_darshan.description: Viewing the main temple's Vimana (peak) through the horns of the Nandi at this location
shikhara_darshan.translation: Seeing the peak of Srisailam destroys the cycle of rebirth

pathalaganga_snanam.name: Pathalaganga Sacred Bath
pathalaganga_snanam.location: Krishna River, 852 steps below temple (or ropeway)
pathalaganga_snanam.description: Bathing in the sacred waters believed to have curative properties from medicinal plants in the catchment area

pilgrimage_order.spiritual_significance: This sequence mirrors spiritual progression: removing duality, engaging consciousness, receiving energy
pilgrimage_order.note: No strict mandate, but this is the traditional pilgrim route

major_festivals.name: Maha Shivaratri
major_festivals.description: The grandest festival of the temple

special_rituals.name: Lingodbhava Puja
special_rituals.significance: Celebrates the emergence of Shiva as a pillar of infinite light

special_rituals.name: Pagalaman / Pagaalankarana
special_rituals.description: A unique ritual where a weaver decorates the Nandi and temple Vimana with a massive continuous cloth (Paagaa)
special_rituals.how: Done in total darkness by a weaver who climbs the tower naked and blindfolded
special_rituals.significance: Symbolizes absolute surrender and faith—trusting the Lord completely in darkness

major_festivals.name: Ugadi - Nandi Kamba Festival
major_festivals.description: Attracts massive crowds, especially from Karnataka
major_festivals.special_practice: Devotees walk hundreds of kilometers carrying Nandi Kamba (decorated poles) to offer to Mallikarjuna
major_festivals.unique_aspect: Devotees call the deity their 'Son-in-law' due to the Chenchu marriage legend

major_festivals.name: Kumbhotsavam
major_festivals.timing: First Tuesday or Friday after Chaitra Pournami
major_festivals.description: Vast quantities of pumpkins, lemons, coconuts, and turmeric-rice (Kumbham) are heaped before the Goddess
major_festivals.note: This replaced ancient animal sacrifices with vegetarian offerings

major_festivals.name: Karthika Deepotsavam
major_festivals.description: The month of lights—millions of lamps (Deepams) are lit throughout the temple premises
major_festivals.significance: Karthika Masam is especially sacred for Shiva worship

amavasya.name: New Moon
amavasya.significance: Shiva visits Kartikeya on this day
amavasya.blessing: Special for reconciliation and family harmony

poornima.name: Full Moon
poornima.significance: Parvati visits Kartikeya on this day
poornima.blessing: Special for mother's blessings and emotional healing

primary.name: Mallikarjuna Dhyana Mantra
primary.meaning: Salutations to the Lord adorned with Jasmine

shivananda_lahari.name: Shivananda Lahari Opening Verse
shivananda_lahari.sanskrit:
कला'भ्यां चूडालङ्कृतससि कला'भ्यां निजतपः-
फला'भ्यां भक्तेषु प्रकतित-फला'भ्यां भवतु मे।
shivananda_lahari.meaning: I prostrate to Shiva and Parvati, whose matted crests are adorned by the crescent moon, who are the fruits of each other's penance

for_bhramaramba.name: Bhramaramba Stuti
for_bhramaramba.meaning: Salutations to the Mother of Bees
